Dialogue:
HW: Hello!
CA: Hello!
HW: What's your favorite food?
CA: Ramen. Yours?
HW: Sushi. What flavor of ramen do you like?
CA: Soy sauce.
HW: I like salt flavor with hard thin noodles.
CA: Favorite store?
HW: Afuri's shio ramen.
CA: In Kanagawa?
HW: It's a nationwide chain.
CA: I'll search for a nearby one.
HW: Try Raoh's yuzu salt flavor.
CA: Noted.
HW: Seasonal, during hot pot season.
CA: Limited-time. Yuzu is a winter fruit.
HW: Should be year-round.
CA: Shio ramen sounds delicious.
HW: Shio ramen is tasty.
CA: Visit ramen shops post-pandemic?
HW: Top-ranked shops interest me.
CA: Long lines.
HW: They are spread out, with one in Tokyo.
CA: Ramen masters too?
HW: Photos in magazines and packages.
CA: Convenient for fans.
HW: Collaboration products are easier to get now.
CA: Convenient. Talk again soon?
HW: Yes, let's talk again.

HW: Hello  
CA: Hello  
HW: What is your favorite drink?  
CA: Coffee. For alcohol, shochu and sake. You?  
HW: Non-caffeinated tea. I don't drink alcohol much.  
CA: Black tea is popular. Non-caffeinated drinks are gaining interest.  
HW: I usually have decaf coffee, rooibos tea, or herbal teas.  
CA: Reducing caffeine is beneficial.  
HW: I have a weak stomach, so I limit caffeine. Any coffee tips?  
CA: Instant black coffee paired with white chocolate.  
HW: I'll try it.  
CA: Caffeine can affect the stomach.  
HW: Yes, coffee on an empty stomach hurts. Warm drinks are better.  
CA: Listen to your body.  
HW: Decaf means non-caffeine.  
CA: Yes, same meaning.  
HW: Non-caffeine is popular with pregnant women and those with weak stomachs.  
CA: It's beneficial for many.  
HW: It's healthy and tasty!  
CA: Do you have a cat?  
HW: No, allergic but love cat videos.  
CA: Noted.  
HW: Cats are soothing, especially with pink noses or white socks.  
CA: Imagining it is comforting.  
HW: The Mochineko channel on Youtube is good. Thanks! Let's talk again!  
CA: Acknowledged. Let's talk again!

HW: Thank you in advance.  
EU: Nice to meet you, please let me know how I can assist you.  
HW: It's a perfect day for sports, isn't it? Do you have any sports you're good at?  
EU: I'm not very skilled at sports, but I enjoy swimming. How about you?  
HW: Swimming, huh! Today is perfect for swimming! I play tennis as a hobby.  
EU: Tennis is interesting! It's known as the gentleman's game.  
HW: Yes, that's right. Skilled people have a gentlemanly form.  
EU: It seems quite hot in the summer; you might need to be careful. Tennis involves hard movements.  
HW: It's the kind of temperature today that makes you want to swim in the sea rather than play tennis. Have you gone swimming this year?  
EU: The only thing I've done is go to the local public pool with my child. We had originally planned to go to the river today.  
HW: The public pool looks fun! I'm envious.  
EU: Due to the coronavirus situation, it wasn't too crowded, which was good.  
HW: It's great that it wasn't crowded! I like the cool feeling of a private pool.  
EU: A private pool sounds nice!  
HW: When I was a child, there was a time when I arrived at the public pool first thing in the morning, and it was almost like having it all to myself. It left an impression on me because it felt different from usual.  
EU: Wow! Does "first thing in the morning" mean around 8 o'clock?  
HW: I think it was probably about that time. After that, I swam with a friend and ate ice cream. Don't you think there are a lot of ice cream vending machines at the public pool?  
EU: Yes, there's an ice cream vending machine. Cup noodles and such are also really delicious at that time.  
HW: You get hungry after swimming, don't you?  
EU: Everything I eat is really delicious. I feel like swimming now. Apologies for talking only about myself.  
HW: I like listening to people, so it's okay.  
EU: You are very kind. I'd love to hear more about tennis next time.  
HW: If it's about unusual tennis plays, I can always talk about them.  
EU: Rare play! That sounds interesting.  
HW: I'm having a good time with my tennis club friends. Could it make for an essay comic? Hahaha.  
EU: You're in a club! How serious! Are you an expert?  
HW: This is a beginner's tennis club that often makes funny mistakes. Let's talk again sometime soon!  
EU: I'd like that. Please let me talk with you again!  
HW: Yes! Thank you very much!  
EU: Thank you very much!!

HW: Thank you in advance!
IM: You’re welcome.
HW: It's almost dinnertime!
IM: Has the menu been decided?
HW: We plan to buy a paella kit and make it together.
IM: Paella sounds good. I like seafood dishes.
HW: It can be quickly made with a frozen seafood mix and paella seasoning.
IM: Nice. I usually make pasta with seafood mix.
HW: What are you having for dinner tonight?
IM: Leftover curry from yesterday.
HW: Curry gets better over time.
IM: Curry tastes better the next day. Seafood curry could be nice too.
HW: I'll try seafood curry next time.
IM: I have never made it. 
HW: Just add the frozen seafood mix at the end.
IM: Noted. Do you cook often?
HW: I cook every day but only make usual dishes.
IM: Practical.
HW: I only cook when necessary and don't enjoy it. Do you cook or bake?
IM: I’m not good at cooking but want to try.
HW: I have extra bananas, so I want to make a banana dessert.
IM: Banana sweets look good. Any recommendations?
HW: Try banana bread with bananas and pancake mix.
IM: Looks easy to make.
HW: I will make it again when butter is cheaper.
IM: Is butter expensive now?
HW: Yes, ingredient prices are high due to living costs.
IM: I will buy finished products until it gets cheaper.
HW: I will too. Let’s talk again!
IM: Okay.

HW: Thank you.  
IM: You're welcome.  
HW: I'm watching anime, any recommendations?  
IM: Demon Slayer.  
HW: Did you watch the anime or read the manga?  
IM: Both.  
HW: I've only watched the anime. Didn't it take a lot of time?  
IM: Yes.  
HW: The animation was beautiful.  
IM: Yes. Do you watch anime often?  
HW: Do you have a favorite character?  
IM: Tanjiro.  
HW: I'll check out Hanae-san's YouTube channel.  
IM: Currently busy, can't watch anime or YouTube.  
HW: Watching videos takes a lot of time.  
IM: Yes. Do you watch anime often?  
HW: I binge-watch when I have time.  
IM: I watch about two seasons when I can.  
HW: Binge-watching is fun. Do you eat anything while watching anime?  
IM: Yes, potato chips.  
HW: What flavor do you like?  
IM: Lightly salted or limited edition.  
HW: I had thick-cut ridged potato chips.  
IM: I'll try them. They make your hands dirty.  
HW: When eating, you can't do other tasks.  
IM: Yes, touched my smartphone and it was a problem.  
HW: That must have been tough.  
IM: Now, I use wet tissues.  
HW: That's a good habit. Thanks.  
IM: Thank you.

HW: Thank you in advance.
IM: You're welcome.
HW: It's hot every day, isn't it?
IM: Yes, it is. Do you have any tips to stay cool?
HW: I'm using a cool towel that gets chilly with water.
IM: What is a cool ring?
HW: It's a ring that freezes below 28°C and doesn't wet your clothes.
IM: Useful.
HW: Yes, it keeps the neck dry unlike towels.
IM: Wet clothes and bulky luggage are issues.
HW: Summer luggage can be heavy.
IM: Traveling with lots of luggage is troublesome.
HW: Compact luggage helps. I like carrying my favorite drink.
IM: Many drinks available. Any recommendations?
HW: Jasmine tea or flavored tea powder, but it may not be for everyone.
IM: I like jasmine tea. Flavored tea powder sounds interesting.
HW: There's an apple and vanilla-flavored tea powder at the supermarket.
IM: Convenient. I now prefer water.
HW: Water is healthy. Do you prefer hard or soft water?
IM: I find hard water unpleasant.
HW: Hard water isn't good for tea and feels different to drink.
IM: My mother liked hard water, so we had both at home.
HW: Understood.
IM: Hard water is suitable for cooking.
HW: I didn't know that. Water is more complex than I thought.
IM: The type of water used does vary.
HW: I'll look into it more.
IM: I will research it too.
HW: Thank you for the conversation.
IM: You're welcome.

HW: Thank you in advance!  
IM: Thank you in advance!  
HW: Do you like animals?  
IM: Yes, I like them so much that I even have pets at home!  
HW: What kind of animal do you have?  
IM: I have a cat at home! It’s a stray cat, so it doesn’t have a pedigree, but it’s just so cute and soothing.  
HW: Do you have a cat? What color is your cat?  
IM: It's a milk tea color! Are pets not allowed?  
HW: I have a cat allergy, so I can't keep one.  
IM: I see, that must be tough.  
HW: I watch cats on TV shows. Living with a cat seems fun.  
IM: It's fun, but taking care of living creatures can be challenging.  
HW: What kind of things are difficult, for example?  
IM: There are various difficulties, but the biggest one is not being able to travel, I suppose.  
HW: I see. Is traveling still difficult even with water dispensers and automatic feeders?  
IM: What, there is something that convenient! I didn't know.  
HW: I saw it on Amazon. The world is convenient.  
IM: If I have that, I might be able to go on a trip. I didn't know because I haven't used Amazon much.  
HW: I haven't used it either. Is your cat already big?  
IM: He is older in age and also quite a large, chubby cat.  
HW: Big cats are wonderful too. They have a different cuteness compared to kittens.  
IM: That's right, kittens are cute, but the feeling of holding a big cat is completely different.  
HW: Life with a cat seems fun.  
IM: These days, you can even watch it on YouTube, so even people who can't keep pets can enjoy it. Do you watch YouTube or anything like that?  
HW: Sometimes, I watch cat videos. There are also various cat toys.  
IM: There are lots of cat toys, but they get bored with them quickly, don't they?  
HW: That's a problem.  
IM: Therefore, we have a large amount of unused toys in our house. This is also one of the difficult things.  
HW: Thank you for the enjoyable conversation! Let's talk again!  
IM: Please do it again.

HW: Thank you.
IM: You're welcome.
HW: It's hot lately.
IM: Yes, summer is enjoyable.
HW: Why do you like summer?
IM: It's fun everywhere, especially the sea and mountains.
HW: The green mountains and clouds are beautiful.
IM: Yes, the summer sky looks great.
HW: I like visiting resorts and mountains but haven't recently. Have you traveled?
IM: Planning to go back home for Obon.
HW: Mountains or sea?
IM: Mountains.
HW: Living near mountains is nice.
IM: Yes. Do you have summer plans?
HW: I planned to travel during Obon, but with COVID-19 rising, I'm waiting.
IM: Yes, travel is limited.
HW: COVID-19 has changed a lot.
IM: Yes, my recital got canceled again.
HW: What lessons?
IM: Piano.
HW: How many years?
IM: Almost 10 years. The recital is my goal.
HW: Ten years is impressive.
IM: Thanks. Do you continue anything?
HW: Cooking classes sometimes.
IM: How long?
HW: Occasionally, not regularly.
IM: I can't cook.
HW: Thank you. Let's talk again.
IM: Goodbye.
